page.title: 06Shops.
page.content: One or two small specialised shops have opened in the Leighton/ Linslade areas as one might have expected in this out of town location. There is a picture framing buisiness and an animal food shop with small pets for sale. Two antique/bric-a-brac shops stand almost opposite one another, one specialising in the very popular current trend for stripped pine furniture. Estate agents are new-comers to this area but seem to be establishing healthy trade out of town. There are several ladies hairdressers and a barber obviously drawn by high density of population and low rents and rates. There is a smart restaurent called "Axtell's" at which the French style cooking costs around Â£8.00 to Â£9.00 for a main course.
